div.p: From Frederick Bailey to Alexander Peacock
Letter press copy book 3, pp. 673-4, Queensland Herbarium, Brisbane.

I have the honor to inform you that about three years ago I was requested by a large number of persons in this, and the southern colonies to undertake the preparation of a supplementary volume to Bentham's Flora Australiensis.
Bentham (1863-78).

After duly considering the matter I issued a circular
See F. Bailey to M, March 1893 (in this edition as 93-03-00b). stating my willingness to comply with the wishes of my friends and saying that I hoped to accomplish the work in about eighteen months.

Hearing, however, that a few persons were of opinion that the late Baron von Mueller should be the one to prepare such a [...] volume I wrote to him on the subject stating that if he would engage to prepare it entirely on the plan of the preceding 7 volumes I would gladly leave the work to him, although I had advanced with the manuscript a good deal. He wrote me that it was his desire to prepare the volume and thanking me for giving up in his favor; but with the exception of once referring to me with respect to the arrangement of one order, I have heard nothing from him or any one since as to the progress (if any was being made) of the work.

Thus briefly I lay the matter before you and would now ask in the event of the manuscript not being ready for the printer that it may be placed in my hands for completion; that might be deemed my right as being now senior botanist of Australia

As already telegraphed I deeply regret the death of this scientist.
Bailey telegrammed Peacock, on10 October 1896, 'Allow me to express deep regret at death of my old colleague Baron Mueller' (see his letter-press copy book 3, p. 672, Queensland Herbarium, Brisbane).
